comments:
When I choose different port (for example 11002) in serviceconfig.xml for AC and also correct preferences in workbench to match new ports
the profiling cannot be run and following error is displayed:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException
Agent Controller is unavailable under port 11002.  Make sure that the service is started and the port number is correct under preferences.

org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.exceptions.AgentControllerUnavailableException: Error: Unable to connect to the Agent Controller.Connection refused: connect
  at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.NodeImpl.connect(NodeImpl.java:146)
  at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.util.AgentControllerDelegate$1$EstablishConnection.run(AgentControllerDelegate.java:155)
  at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
Did you configure this in the GUI when you tried to connect
I changed the AC to run on the non-default port and modified the Preferences in the P&L to reflect the same and it works for me.

traces.message: Error: Unable to connect to the Agent Controller.Connection refused: connect
